DataElement.preferredName: Informed Consent Optional Biospecimen Storage Negation Complete Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason a patient did not sign and date the optional consent for biospecimen storage.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Informed Consent Optional Biospecimen Storage Negation Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved._Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

Concepts.definition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

Property.preferredDefinition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
